alert.note: Alert for Bienville; Bossier; De Soto; Red River; Sabine; Webster (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued November 04 at 10:56PM CDT until November 05 at 12:00AM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 PM CDT FOR SOUTH CENTRAL WEBSTER...SOUTHEASTERN DE SOTO...NORTHWESTERN RED RIVER...SOUTHEASTERN CADDO...WEST CENTRAL BIENVILLE...SOUTHEASTERN BOSSIER AND NORTH CENTRAL SABINE PARISHES... At 1055 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 7 miles west of Ringgold to 7 miles southeast of Mansfield, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Carmel, Curtis, Caspiana, Grand Bayou, Lake Bistineau South, Elm Grove, Plum Orchard Landing, Loggy Bayou, Koran, Ninock, Pelican, Noles Landing, Lake Bistineau North and Mc Dade. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for northwestern Louisiana. A Tornado Watch also remains in effect until 400 AM CDT for northwestern Louisiana. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Intense thunderstorm lines can produce brief tornadoes and widespread significant wind damage. Although a tornado is not immediately likely, it is best to move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. These storms may cause serious injury and significant property damage.

area.areaDesc: Bienville; Bossier; De Soto; Red River; Sabine; Webster
